p: Increasingly, it is recognized that other organ systems, besides the pulmonary system, can be adversely affected by infection with SARS-CoV‑2. A retrospective, observational analysis of 214 confirmed cases of COVID-19, specifically studied those with severe pneumonia, using criteria established by the American Thoracic Society [ 17]. Of those patients with severe pneumonia, 36.4% had neurological manifestations of disease, such as acute cerebrovascular disease (5.7%), impaired consciousness (14.8%) and skeletal muscle injury (19.3%). Coagulation disorders and cardiac manifestations of COVID-19 infection have also been reported [ 18, 19].
